1.text: Man that is born of a woman is of few days and full of trouble.

2.text: He comes forth like a flower, and is cut down: he flees also as a shadow, and continues not.

3.text: And does you open your eyes on such an one, and bring me into judgment with you?

4.text: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? not one.

5.text: Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months are with you, you have appointed his bounds that he cannot pass;

6.text: Turn from him, that he may rest, till he shall accomplish, as an hireling, his day.

7.text: For there is hope of a tree, if it be cut down, that it will sprout again, and that the tender branch thereof will not cease.

8.text: Though the root thereof wax old in the earth, and the stock thereof die in the ground;

9.text: Yet through the scent of water it will bud, and bring forth boughs like a plant.

10.text: But man dies, and wastes away: yes, man gives up the ghost, and where is he?

11.text: As the waters fail from the sea, and the flood decays and dries up:

12.text: So man lies down, and rises not: till the heavens be no more, they shall not awake, nor be raised out of their sleep.

13.text: O that you would hide me in the grave, that you would keep me secret, until your wrath be past, that you would appoint me a set time, and remember me!

14.text: If a man die, shall he live again? all the days of my appointed time will I wait, till my change come.

15.text: You shall call, and I will answer you: you will have a desire to the work of your hands.

16.text: For now you number my steps: do you not watch over my sin?

17.text: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and you sew up my iniquity.

18.text: And surely the mountains falling comes to nothing, and the rock is removed out of his place.

19.text: The waters wear the stones: you wash away the things which grow out of the dust of the earth; and you destroy the hope of man.

20.text: You prevail for ever against him, and he passes: you change his countenance, and send him away.

21.text: His sons come to honor, and he knows it not; and they are brought low, but he perceives it not of them.

22.text: But his flesh on him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.
